title: Vegetable Garden Quiz
description: Put your green thumb knowledge to the test! How much do you know about growing and identifying common garden vegetables?

questions.question: Which vegetable is botanically a fruit and comes in varieties like Roma, Beefsteak, and Cherry?
What popular garden vegetable grows underground and is harvested by digging up the soil?
Which vegetable is known as a "cole crop" and forms a tight head of leaves?
What is the practice of growing plants together that benefit each other called?
Which garden vegetable can be harvested as a "baby" leaf or allowed to form a full head?
Zucchini belongs to which plant family?
Which vegetable is famous for being one of the fastest-growing, often ready to harvest in about 25 days?
What is the term for planting crops in a different spot each year to prevent soil depletion?
Which vegetable plant produces both male and female flowers on the same vine?
Sweet corn is best harvested at what stage for the sweetest flavor?
Which of these vegetables is a member of the allium family?
What vegetable was originally purple before orange varieties were developed in the Netherlands?
Which vegetable plant needs a trellis or support structure because it climbs using tendrils?
Asparagus is unique among garden vegetables because it is a what?
options: Biennial that fruits every two years
Tropical plant grown as an annual
Perennial that produces for many years

questions.question: Which vegetable gets its name from the Italian word for "flowering crest of a cabbage"?
